about.title: Introducing the CyberCrew Web Vulnerability Scanner
about.intro: At CyberCrew, we believe that awareness begins with experience — and true cybersecurity starts with visibility.
about.description: Our Web Vulnerability Scanner is a powerful platform designed to help organizations discover, understand, and respond to security risks within their web applications and APIs. Built with usability and clarity in mind, it offers a streamlined dashboard where both technical teams and decision-makers can monitor security status at a glance.
about.featureDashboard1: Track active, completed, pending, and failed scans.
about.featureDashboard2: View vulnerability counts by severity: High, Medium, Low, and Informational.
about.featureDashboard3: Analyze risk distribution with clear visualizations.
about.featureTarget1: Register and manage multiple scan targets (e.g., websites, APIs).
about.featureTarget2: Launch scans manually or on a schedule.
about.featureTarget3: View scan history and status for each target.
about.featureAlerts1: Instantly see where critical vulnerabilities exist.
about.featureAlerts2: Receive email alerts after scans are completed.
about.featureAlerts3: Reports are sent directly to your inbox for secure handling.
about.featureMultilingual: Switch seamlessly between English, Japanese, and Sinhala for global usability.
about.security1: We don't just simulate attacks—we show you the real risks.
about.security2: Our team performs manual scan execution, ensuring deeper accuracy than fully automated tools.
about.security3: Sensitive data is never exposed in the dashboard. All detailed results are securely sent via email to protect your environment and your privacy.
about.teamTitle: Designed for Teams Who Take Security Seriously
about.teamDescription: Whether you manage a single website or an entire enterprise network, CyberCrew equips you with the insight and control to secure your assets—before attackers can exploit them.
about.quote: Let the experience of being attacked become your strongest defense.
